#Text=Thousands gather in Jantar Mantar and other cities to protest against mob violence
#Text=Friday , June 30 , 2017

#Text=On Wednesday , thousands of citizens gathered in New Delhi 's Jantar Mantar and other cities across India to protest against mob violence against minority communities of Muslims and Dalits , which has increased in recent years .

#Text=Documentary film-maker Saba Dewan asked for " protest against the lynchings " via a Facebook post on June 24 , after a teenage Muslim boy , Junaid Khan , and his brothers were reportedly racially abused , and Junaid allegedly stabbed and killed by a mob , after a dispute last week in Haryana .

#Text=About 2000 people gathered for the protest — Not in my Name — in the Indian capital , while several others protested in Bombay , Allahabad , Lucknow , Patna , Hyderabad , Bangalore , Chennai , Kolkata , Thiruvananthapuram , Chandigarh , Kochi , and Jaipur .
#Text=There were protests held in London as well .
#Text=The protests came after several instances where people were killed due to mob violence , the victims mostly from the minority communities of Muslims and Dalits .
#Text=Protesters held placards with messages such as " No Place for Islamophobia " , " Break the Silence " , and " Shed Hate not Blood " .

column1: #Text=Saba Dewan said , " the protest is against this systematic violence against Muslims and Dalits that is going on in our country at the moment " .
#Text=The protesters presented poems , songs and danced on stage on the Jantar Manter to express their views .
#Text=Manish Sisodia , New Delhi 's deputy chief minister , also took part in the protest .
#Text=In Bombay , protesters were permitted till 7 PM .
#Text=" Should n't there be protests against the lynchings especially after the murder yesterday in Delhi NCR by a mob of a 16 year old Muslim boy ?

#Text=Junaid 's brother Hasseem said the people  were pointing at a packet which had food and saying we should not be allowed to sit since we were carrying beef " even though he told they were not carrying beef .

column1: #Text=The mob , reportedly threw Junaid 's skull cap , and called them " beef eaters " and " anti-nationalists " .
#Text=About twenty people were involved in the violence .
#Text=One man , who was held for the violence told NDTV he was " told by his friends to attack the Muslim boys because they ate beef " .
#Text=Police arrested four people on Wednesday accused for the violence , police superintendent Kamaldeep Goel told the Press Trust of India .
#Text=There have been several instances where people were harassed or killed due to mob violence .
#Text=At least ten Muslims have been reported victims of the mob violence in the past two years , for beef consumption or transporting cows .
#Text=Cow is considered sacred in Hinduism and many Hindus in the country view cow as a god or mother .
#Text=Beef is banned in several states of India and a person found guilty for killing a cow can face a prison term up to ten years .
#Text=But often , the " gau rakshaks " ( cow protectors ) have taken the law in their hands and lynched the accused .
#Text=Some of the claims turned out to be false .
#Text=Though India is a secular state , Prime Minister Narendra Modi of Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) , which shares Hindu nationalist views , vowed to ban beef across India .
#Text=In 2015 , ex- Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said , " Do I assault everyone who eats pork or alcohol ? "
#Text=after Rashid Ahmed was beaten by BJP members for serving beef in a private party .
#Text=Pork and alcohol are considered haram and hence , their consumption is prohibited in Islam .
#Text=" Killing people in the name of ' gau bhakti ' [ cow devotion ] is not acceptable " , Modi said yesterday .
